# check which we can get in 2020 and 2021
def get_trial_info(dataframe, time):
    column_name = 'complete_in_{}'.format(time)
    trials = dataframe.loc[phases_data[column_name] == True, 'Completion Date'].index
    for trial_name in trials:
        if str(dataframe.loc[trial_name]['Acronym']).strip() != 'nan' and str(dataframe.loc[trial_name]['country']).strip() != 'nan':
            print("Name: {}: {}: {} ".format(dataframe.loc[trial_name]['Acronym'],
                                                   dataframe.loc[trial_name]['Completion Date'],
                                                  dataframe.loc[trial_name]['country']))

    
    
phases_data['complete_in_2020'] = phases_data['Completion Date'].apply(lambda x: '2020' in str(x))
phases_data['complete_in_2021'] = phases_data['Completion Date'].apply(lambda x: '2021' in str(x))

get_trial_info(phases_data, '2021')

## Observation from Phase analysis

Most of the vaccine are in the phase 2 and phase 3 stage. And only 8 percent are in the last stage of the clinical research.

Different Stages of the Clinical research are:-

References:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phases_of_clinical_research

(1) Preclinical stage:-   Testing on the non human objects

(2) Phase 1:-  Testing of drug on healthy volunteers for safety; involves testing multiple doses (20–100 normal healthy volunteers (or for cancer drugs, cancer patients))

(3) Phase 2:-  Testing of drug on patients to assess efficacy and side effects (100–300 patients with specific diseases)

(4) Phase 3:-   (300–3,000 patients with specific diseases)

(5) Phase 4: Final Stage of trial; Post marketing surveillance – watching drug use in public
